member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CoreModule.CurrentProject
member.summary: Gets the project that is currently open in the ArcGIS Pro application
member.remarks: Only one project can be opened at a time in ArcGIS Pro. When another project is opened or a new project is created, this property is updated to reflect the newly opened project.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CoreModule.OnProjectClosedForTests(System.String)
member.summary: When running in MVVM tests, tests that timeout can leave the project open sequence in an invalid state. This can make several tests to automatically fail, because they can not open a project. We need a better way to deal with timeout. Once, we have a better way, we can get rid of this method.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions
member.summary: Gets and sets the application general options

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.StartupOption
member.summary: Gets and sets the application startup mode.
member.remarks: Attempting to set StartupOption to will be ignored if does not contain a path to a valid .aprx. To set StartupOption to StartProjectMode.WithDefaultProject, the StartupProjectPath must be set first/>.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.StartupProjectPath
member.summary: Gets and sets the path to a default project (.aprx) to use when the application starts
member.remarks:
Attempting to set StartupProjectPath to an invalid .aprx path will be ignored.
Set to after setting the StartupProjectPath (to use the StartupProjectPath at start-up). Attempting to set the StartupOption to StartProjectMode.WithDefaultProject before the StartupProjectPath contains a valid .aprx path will be ignored.
Conversely, attempting to set the StartupProjectPath back to null or empty string will be ignored if StartupOption is currently set to StartProjectMode.WithDefaultProject. The StartupOption must be changed to a different start mode first.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.HomeFolderOption
member.summary: Gets and sets whether new projects are saved to the default home folder location or a custom location.
member.remarks: When true, newly created projects are saved to the user profile directory at Documents\ArcGIS\Projects. Set HomeFolderOption to to use a custom location (defined in ) instead. Note: attempting to set HomeFolderOption to UseCustom will be ignored if does not already contain a path to a valid folder. To set HomeFolderOption to UseCustom, the CustomHomeFolder must be set first/>.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.CustomHomeFolder
member.summary: Gets and sets the path to a custom default home folder location to use with new projects
member.remarks:
Attempting to set CustomHomeFolder to an invalid folder will be ignored.
Set to to use the custom folder location for newly created projects.
Note: attempting to set HomeFolderOption to UseCustom before CustomHomeFolder contains a valid path will be ignored.
Conversely, attempting to set the CustomHomeFolder back to null or empty string will also be ignored unless HomeFolderOption is first set to UseDefault.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.ProjectCreateInFolder
member.summary: Gets and sets whether to store the project file, project geodatabase, and project toolbox in a folder named for the project.
member.remarks: If ProjectCreateInFolder is set to true (the default), then a subfolder named for the project will be created (within whatever is the location being used for the new project). If ProjectCreateInFolder is set to false then project default files are stored in the default project location without organizing them into their own folder.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.DefaultGeodatabaseOption
member.summary: Gets and sets whether new projects are created with a new file geodatabase or with an existing geodatabase.
member.remarks: When set to , newly created projects are created with a new file geodatabase. Set DefaultGeodatabaseOption to to use a path to an existing geodatabase (defined in ) instead. Note: attempting to set DefaultGeodatabaseOption to UseCustom will be ignored if CustomDefaultGeodatabase does not already contain a path to a valid geodatabase. To set DefaultGeodatabaseOption to UseCustom, the CustomDefaultGeodatabase must be set first/>.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.CustomDefaultGeodatabase
member.summary: Gets and sets the path to the default geodatabase to use with new projects
member.remarks:
Default geodatabases can be either file (.gdb) or enterprise (.sde). Attempting to set the path to a non-file or enterprise gdb is ignored. Set to after setting the CustomDefaultGeodatabase (to use the CustomDefaultGeodatabase with newly created projects). Attempting to set the DefaultGeodatabaseOption to UseCustom before CustomDefaultGeodatabase contains a valid path will be ignored.
Conversely, attempting to set the CustomDefaultGeodatabase back to null or empty string will be ignored if DefaultGeodatabaseOption is currently set to UseCustom. DefaultGeodatabaseOption must be changed to UseDefault first.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.DefaultToolboxOption
member.summary: Gets and sets whether new projects are created with a new toolbox or with an existing toolbox.
member.remarks: When set to , newly created projects are created with a new default toolbox. Set DefaultToolboxOption to to use a path to an existing toolbox (defined in ) instead. Note: attempting to set DefaultToolboxOption to UseCustom will be ignored if ProjectCustomDefaultToolbox does not already contain a path to a valid toolbox. To set DefaultToolboxOption to UseCustom, the ProjectCustomDefaultToolbox must be set first/>.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.CustomDefaultToolbox
member.summary: Gets and sets the path to a toolbox to use as the default toolbox for new projects
member.remarks:
Set to after setting the CustomDefaultToolbox (to use the CustomDefaultToolbox with newly created projects). Attempting to set the DefaultToolboxOption to UseCustom before CustomDefaultToolbox contains a valid path will be ignored.
Conversely, attempting to set the CustomDefaultToolbox back to null or empty string will be ignored if DefaultToolboxOption is currently set to UseCustom. The DefaultToolboxOption must be changed to UseDefault first.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.CreateProjectBackups
member.summary: Gets and sets whether a backup is to be created when a project has unsaved changes. Use to define the time interval for saving the backup.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.ProjectBackupInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the time interval (in minutes) to elapse after which a project backup is saved if is true.
member.remarks: The time interval must be between 1 and 999 inclusive. Other values are ignored.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.PortalProjectDownloadLocation
member.summary: Gets and sets the download location for portal projects
member.remarks: Portal projects will be downloaded and cached in the location specified. Setting the download location to null or empty string will default it back to the original default (typically the Documents\ArcGIS\OnlineProjects in your user profile)

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.PortalProjectDeleteLocalCopyOnClose
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the downloaded local copy of a portal project is preserved when you close the project.
member.remarks: The local copy (also called the cached copy) contains the changes you make to a portal project after downloading it. These changes are uploaded to the portal when you save the project.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.PortalProjectCustomHomeFolder
member.summary: Gets and sets the default location for output files created in the local copy that are not saved to a geodatabase.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.PortalProjectCustomDefaultGeodatabase
member.summary: Gets and sets the default location for output files created in the local copy that are saved to a geodatabase.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.GeneralOptions.PortalProjectCustomDefaultToolbox
member.summary: Gets and sets the default location for geoprocessing models created in the local copy. A toolbox stored in a geodatabase cannot be the default toolbox

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.DownloadOptions.StagingLocation
member.summary: Gets and sets the application staging location
member.remarks: Used when the application is staging content for publishing and packaging. If the folder does not exist, the application attempts to create it when the value is assigned. Attempting to assign a folder location to which the current user does not have write permission will fail. Set to empty string to revert to the application default.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.DownloadOptions.UnpackPPKXLocation
member.summary: Gets and sets the folder location for unpacking project packages and project templates
member.remarks: Setting an unpacking location automatically sets the property to false. If the folder does not exist, the application attempts to create it when the value is assigned. Attempting to assign a folder location to which the current user does not have write permission will fail. Set to empty string to revert to the application default.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.DownloadOptions.AskForUnpackPPKXLocation
member.summary: Gets and sets the 'Ask where to save before unpacking' option for project packages and templates.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true automatically clears out the property. This property is automatically set to false if the property is set (via add-in or UI).

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.DownloadOptions.UnpackOtherLocation

member.remarks:
Setting an unpacking location automatically sets the and properties to false.

member.remarks:
Setting this property to true automatically clears out the property and sets the property to false.
This property is automatically set to false if the property is set or is set to true.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EditingOptions.CanSetVertexSymbolOptions(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.VertexSymbolType,ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.VertexSymbolOptions)
member.summary: Determines if the vertex sketch symbol can be set.
member.param: The type of vertex symbol to obtain.
The vertex symbol.
member.remarks:
This function should be called prior to to ensure the parameters are valid. It checks the following
Outline width can be null or a positive number (ie greater than 0)
Size can be null or a positive number (ie greater than 0)
Angle rotation can be null or between -360 and 360
member.returns: True if the vertex symbol options are valid. False otherwise.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EditingOptions.SetVertexSymbolOptions(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.VertexSymbolType,ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.VertexSymbolOptions)
member.summary: Sets the symbol for a vertex while sketching. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: The type of vertex symbol to obtain.
The new vertex symbol.
member.remarks: This method calls the function prior to setting the symbol values. If the options are invalid, no updates are made to the symbol.
member.exception: This method or property must be called within the lambda passed to QueuedTask.Run.
Symbol options are not valid. See for details on option settings.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ArcGISPortal
member.summary: The ArcGISPortal class is part of the Pro Portal API which provides a way to build applications that work with content from ArcGIS Online or an ArcGIS Portal. ArcGIS Portal is software technology from Esri that customers can deploy either on premise or in the cloud. ArcGIS Online is Esri's Software as a Service offering that represents GIS as a Service and is implemented using the same technology as ArcGIS Portal. The Portal API allows application developers to work with users, groups and content hosted within ArcGIS Online or within an ArcGIS Portal.
member.remarks: ArcGISPortal instances are instantiated using the and its AddPortal method.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ArcGISPortal.PortalUri
member.summary: Gets the portal Uri for this portal instance

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ArcGISPortal.IsSignedOn
member.summary: Gets the sign on status of the portal instance. This method should be called from within a QueuedTask or System.Threading.Task unless the caller is within in which case the main thread should be used.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ArcGISPortal.GetToken
member.summary: Gets the current token for the session. The ArcGISPortal class automatically manages the token expiration. This value should not be cached. This method should be called from within a QueuedTask or System.Threading.Task unless the caller is within in which case the main thread should be used.
member.returns: a that is the current token

member.returns: A containing the SignIn status

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.BackstageTabIndependentScrollingBehavior
member.summary: This behavior is intended to be used with a UserControl that is the view for a Backstage tab. The Backstage control is an Actipro control that contains its own ScrollViewer. The viewport for that ScrollViewer includes the title bar ("non-clien") area of the window. Therefore, the vertical scroll bar for that ScrollViewer overlaps the system controls in the top right corner. Additionally, controlling scrolling in the different back stage tabs can be difficult when interacting with that top level ScrollViewer. This behavior disables the the scrolling of that top level ScrollViewer when the UserControl is loaded (and set it back to auto when unloaded). It also sets the size of the UserControl to the content area made available by the Backstage control. This simplifies scrolling behavior in the different backstage tabs and prevents the fairly normal occurrence of double scrollbars when that top levet ScrollViewer is enabled.

member.summary: Setup the Behaviour

member.summary: Sets the Visibility of the horizontal ScrollBar as needed by the ScrollViewer, BUT Hidden instead of collapsed

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.DeviceLocation.DeviceLocationService
member.summary: Represents the device location service for connecting to GPS/GNSS devices.
member.remarks:
There can only be one device location source open at any one time.
You cannot create a DeviceLocationService instance. Instead use the property to access the singleton DeviceLocationService instance which will have been already created.
Subscribe to event to receive coordinates and metadata from the open device location source .
To interact with the current or active map view using the device location, use the instance.
Subscribe to the to receive notifications when the current device location source is changed.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.UploadDefinition
member.summary: Represents a class to provide parameters to the Upload method on EsriHttpClient class.
member.remarks:
UploadDefinition class allows you to define upload parameters.
Once you create an instance of , you can call its Upload method to upload an item

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.UploadDefinition.PortalURL
member.summary: Gets and sets the URL of the portal to which the item will be uploaded

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.UploadDefinition.ItemToUpload
member.summary: Gets and sets the item to upload
member.remarks:
The following items are currently supported:
ArcGIS Geoprocessing package (gpk)
ArcGIS Locator package (gcpk)
ArcGIS Map package (mpk)
ArcGIS Mobile Basemap package (bpk)
ArcGIS Mobile Map package (mmpk)
ArcGIS Server Globe service
ArcGIS Server Geometry service
ArcGIS Server Geoprocessing service
ArcGIS Server Geodata service
ArcGIS Server Network analysis service
ArcGIS Task file (esriTasks)
Arcmap document (mxd)
CSV: A text file of data values separated by commas or other delimiters (csv)
Feature service
Geocoding service
Image service
KML file
Layer file (lyr) or (lyrx)
Layer package (lpk)
Map service
Microsoft Excel Document (.xls, .xlsx)
Tile package (tpk)
Compact Tile package (tpkx)
Vector Tile package (vtpk)

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.UploadDefinition.Thumbnail
member.summary: Gets and sets the path, on disk, for the thumbnail to be uploaded

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.UploadDefinition.Tags
member.summary: Gets and sets the tags to describe the item

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.UploadDefinition.FolderID
member.summary: Gets and sets the folder id of the portal folder into which the item will be uploaded
member.remarks: You can either pass FolderID or but not both. Passing both the properties will result in an exception being thrown on the upload

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.UploadDefinition.FolderName
member.summary: Gets and sets the folder name of the portal folder into which the item will be uploaded
member.remarks: You can either pass or FolderName but not both. Passing both the properties will result in an exception being thrown on the upload

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.UploadDefinition.Summary
member.summary: Gets and sets the Summary of the item being uploaded

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.UploadDefinition.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets the Description of the item being uploaded

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.UploadDefinition.Credits
member.summary: Gets and sets the Credits of the item being uploaded

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.UploadDefinition.CreateFolderIfNotPresent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates if the folder should be created while uploading files
member.remarks: Applies to only. If a FolderID is specified or no FolderID or FolderName is provided then this parameter is ignored. The default value is true

Feature service

KML file

Layer package (lpk)
Map service
Microsoft Excel Document (.xls, .xlsx)
Tile package (tpk)
Compact Tile package (tpkx)
Vector Tile package (vtpk)
member.returns: A binary tuple consisting of a bool and an ItemID. The bool indicates whether the method succeeded or failed.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EsriHttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Represents the collection of Request Headers as defined in RFC 2616.
member.remarks: HTTP headers provide information about the the http request.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EsriHttpRequestHeaders.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EsriHttpRequestHeaders class.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EsriHttpRequestHeaders.Accept
member.summary: Gets the collection of values containing the list of acceptable media types for the response. The default quality factor for each acceptable media type is "q=1"
member.remarks: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.
member.returns: A valid collection of MediaTypeWithQualityHeaderValue

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EsriHttpRequestHeaders.AcceptCharset
member.summary: Gets the collection of values indicating the quality value for the acceptable character sets for the response. Default quality value is "q=1"
member.remarks: The Accept-Charset request-header field can be used to indicate what character sets are acceptable for the response.
member.returns: A valid collection of StringWithQualityHeaderValue

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EsriHttpRequestHeaders.AcceptEncoding
member.summary: Gets the collection of values indicating the quality value for the acceptable content-codings for the response. Default quality value is "q=1"
member.remarks: The Accept-Encoding request-header field is similar to Accept, but restricts the content-codings that are acceptable in the response.
member.returns: A valid collection of StringWithQualityHeaderValue

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EsriHttpRequestHeaders.AcceptLanguage
member.summary: Gets the collection of values indicating the quality value for the acceptable set of natural languages for the response. Default quality value is "q=1"
member.remarks: The Accept-Language request-header field is similar to Accept, but restricts the set of natural languages that are preferred as a response to the request.
member.returns: A valid collection of StringWithQualityHeaderValue

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EsriHttpRequestHeaders.CacheControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the caching behaviour for the response.
member.remarks: The Cache-Control general-header field is used to specify directives that MUST be obeyed by all caching mechanisms along the request/response chain.
member.returns: A value of the Cache-Control header

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EsriHttpRequestHeaders.Connection
member.summary: Gets the value of the Connection header for the response
member.remarks: The Connection general-header field allows the sender to specify options that are desired for that particular connection and MUST NOT be communicated by proxies over further connections.
member.returns: A collection of Header values in string

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EsriHttpRequestHeaders.Host
member.summary: Gets or sets Host header value to use in an HTTP request independent from the request URI. The Host property can consist of a hostname and an optional port number.
member.remarks: The Host request-header field specifies the Internet host and port number of the resource being requested, as obtained from the original URI given by the user or referring resource.
member.returns: A string representation of the Internet host

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EsriHttpRequestHeaders.Pragma
member.summary: Gets any optional behavior specified for the response.
member.remarks: The Pragma general-header field is used to include implementation- specific directives that might apply to any recipient along the request/response chain.
member.returns: A valid collection of NameValueHeaderValue

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.EsriHttpRequestHeaders.UserAgent
member.summary: Gets the value of the User-agent HTTP header
member.remarks: The User-Agent request-header field contains information about the user agent originating the request.
member.returns: A valid collection of ProductInfoHeaderValue

member.summary: Event argument for the project units changed event.

member.summary: Constructor

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Events.ProjectUnitFormatsChangedEventArgs.DefaultsChangedHint
member.summary: Gets which project default unit formats were changed to different unit formats
member.remarks:
If the list is empty then no defaults were changed.
Note: ProjectUnitFormatsChangedEvent is also fired in response to changes made via the Project Options UI off backstage. The DefaultsChangedHint will contain all values for an event originating from the Options UI.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Events.ProjectUnitFormatsChangedEvent
member.summary: Event raised when any of the project unit formats are changed, new ones added or existing ones removed. Unit format changes are per-project
member.remarks:
This event is only fired when there is an active project. Check the to determine if a change of one or more of the project default format units was made as part of the event.
Note: ProjectUnitFormatsChangedEvent is also fired in response to changes made via the Project Options UI off backstage. The will contain all values for an event originating from the Options UI.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Favorite
member.summary: A favorite is a shortcut to a frequently used folder, database, toolbox, server or custom style. Each project contains a collection of favorites accessed via the object.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Favorite.Item
member.summary: Gets the favorite .

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Favorite.IsAddedToAllNewProjects
member.summary: Gets the flag indicating if the favorite is to be added to all new projects.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager
member.summary: Manages the favorites collection. Favorites are a collection of frequently used connections to folders, databases, toolboxes, servers, custom styles and statistical data collections.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.Current
member.summary: Gets the FavoritesManager.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.GetFavorites
member.summary: Retrieves the set of favorites from the favorite collection.
member.returns: A readonly list of .

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.RefreshFavorites
member.summary: Refreshes the contents of the favorites collection.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.CanAddAsFavorite(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Item)
member.summary: Gets whether the item can be added to the favorites collection.
member.param: The item to be checked to see if it's a favorite candidate.
member.returns: True if the item can be made a favorite. False otherwise

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.AddFavorite(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Item)
member.summary: Adds an item to the favorites collection. The item is added to the collection with the value set to false.
member.remarks:
An item can only exist once in the favorite collection. If the item already exists in the favorites collection, then no additional item is added. However the property will be updated to false.
You should always check before passing an item to this method.
member.param: The item to add to the favorite collection. For example a folder connection or a toolbox.
member.returns: The favorite item. Null if the item cannot be added as a favorite.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.AddFavorite(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Item,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds an item to the favorites collection.
member.remarks:
An item can only exist once in the favorite collection. If the item already exists in the favorites collection, then no additional item is added. However the property will be updated according to the value.
You should always check before passing an item to this method.
member.param: The item to add to the favorite collection. For example a folder connection or a toolbox.
Is the new favorite to be added to all new projects.
member.returns: The favorite item. Null if the item cannot be added as a favorite.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.RemoveFavorite(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Item)
member.summary: Removes an item from the favorites collection.
member.param: The item to remove from the favorite collection. For example a folder connection or a toolbox.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.InsertFavorite(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Item,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts an item to the favorites collection. The item is added to the collection with the value set to false.
member.remarks:
An item can only exist once in the favorite collection. If the item already exists in the favorites collection, then no additional item is inserted. However the existing item will be moved to the specified index and the property will be updated to false.
You should always check before passing an item to this method.
member.param: The item to add to the favorite collection. For example a folder connection or a toolbox.
The index at which the item is to be inserted.
member.returns: The favorite item. Null if the item cannot be added as a favorite.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.InsertFavorite(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Item,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts an item to the favorites collection.
member.remarks:
An item can only exist once in the favorite collection. If the item already exists in the favorites collection, then no additional item is inserted. However the existing item will be moved to the specified index and the property will be updated.
You should always check before passing an item to this method.
member.param: The item to add to the favorite collection. For example a folder connection or a toolbox.
The index at which the item is to be inserted.
Is the new favorite to be added to all new projects.
member.returns: The favorite item. Null if the item cannot be added as a favorite.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.GetFavorite(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Item)
member.summary: Gets the item from the favorite collection.
member.param: The item to retrieve from the favorite collection.
member.returns: The favorite item or null if the item is not a part of the favorite collection.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.SetIsAddedToAllNewProjects(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Item)
member.summary: Sets the value to true for the specified item in the favorite collection.
member.param: The item to be updated in the favorites collection.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.FavoritesManager.ClearIsAddedToAllNewProjects(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Item)
member.summary: Sets the value to false for the specified item in the favorite collection.
member.param: The item to be updated in the favorites collection.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Geoprocessing.GPToolExecuteEventHandler
member.summary: Callback delegate, pass a lambda call to .
member.param:
The event name values are:
"OnValidate" - triggers when internal validation is done.
"OnMessage"
"OnProgressMessage"
"OnProgressPos"
"OnBeginExecute" - triggers when execution begins.
"OnEndExecute" - triggers when execution is complete.

Message object. Use following type conversion - see code example below.
"OnValidate" - (o as IGPMessage[])
"OnMessage" - (o as IGPMessage)
"OnProgressMessage" - (string)o
"OnProgressPos" - (int)o
"OnBeginExecute" - o = null
"OnEndExecute" - (o as IGPResult)

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.SystemWindows
member.summary:
The only way Windows OS will let you bring your application's window up to the front is if the thread it is running on is the thread of the foreground window at the time. So, you have to attach the thread of your application to the thread of the foreground window and then bring your application's window to the front. After that you need to detach your thread (this all only happens if the user has another application's window as the foreground active window).
check out this link http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8078677/bringing-mainwindow-to-front-after-splash-screen-shuts-down

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDSaveAsXMLOption
member.summary: Enumeration of options for saving an item’s metadata to an ArcGIS metadata format XML file. The item’s ArcGIS metadata content can be saved to an XML document where the content continues to be stored in the ArcGIS metadata XML format. The amount of content that is filtered out of the item’s metadata depends on the option selected.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDSaveAsXMLOption.esriExactCopy
member.summary: Save a copy of the item’s metadata to an ArcGIS metadata format XML file. The content is not filtered.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDSaveAsXMLOption.esriRemoveMachineNames
member.summary: Save a copy of the item’s metadata to an ArcGIS format XML file. The content is filtered to remove machine names from UNC paths, if they are present.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDSaveAsXMLOption.esriRemoveAllSensitive
member.summary: Save a copy of the item’s metadata to an ArcGIS format XML file. The content is filtered to withhold local file paths, database connection information, URLs that do not begin with http or https, and so on, if it is present.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDSaveAsXMLOption.esriMetadataTemplate
member.summary: Save a copy of the authored metadata content in the item’s metadata to an ArcGIS metadata format XML file. The item’s synchronized properties, thumbnail, and geoprocessing history are not included. The resulting file can be used as a metadata template.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDSaveAsHTMLOption
member.summary: Enumeration of options for saving an item’s ArcGIS metadata to an HTML file. The item’s metadata content can be exported to HTML format for display or use outside the ArcGIS platform. The XSLT stylesheet used to perform this conversion is indicated by the option selected.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDSaveAsHTMLOption.esriCurrentMetadataStyle
member.summary: The XSLT that is used to display metadata for the currently selected metadata style will be used to generate an HTML file.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDSaveAsHTMLOption.esriArcGISBrief
member.summary: The XSLT that is used to display metadata with the Item Description metadata style will be used to generate an HTML file that displays only the most essential content stored in the item’s metadata.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDSaveAsHTMLOption.esriArcGISFull
member.summary: The XSLT that is used to display all metadata content when one of the standard-format metadata styles will be used to generate an HTML file that displays all ArcGIS metadata content.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDExportRemovalOption
member.summary: Enumeration of options for filtering sensitive content out of an item’s metadata. The item’s metadata content is filtered before it is exported to a standard metadata format. The amount of content that is filtered out of the item’s metadata is determined by the option selected.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDExportRemovalOption.esriExportExactCopy
member.summary: The content of the item’s current metadata is not filtered before it is exported to a standard metadata format. All content is exported, including any sensitive information that may be present.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDExportRemovalOption.esriExportRemoveMachineNames
member.summary: The content of the item’s metadata is filtered to remove machine names from UNC paths, if they are present. The remaining metadata content is then exported to a standard metadata format.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDExportRemovalOption.esriExportRemoveAllSensitive
member.summary: The content of the item’s metadata is filtered to remove local file paths, database connection information, URLs that do not begin with http or https, and so on, if this information is present. The remaining metadata content is then exported to a standard metadata format.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDImportExportOption
member.summary:
Enumeration of options for importing metadata to and exporting metadata from an item. Used to identify the XML format of a metadata document that will be imported, or the XML format of the metadata document that will be created on export. An appropriate transformation will take place between the ArcGIS metadata XML format and the indicated XML format. On import, the resulting ArcGIS metadata is saved to the item.
Remarks: On import, if the selected option identifies an XML format that doesn’t match the XML format of the source metadata document the wrong transformation will be performed. The resulting content that is formatted as ArcGIS metadata can be missing some or all of the original content.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDImportExportOption.esriMetadataStyleNone
member.summary: Use this option if you are unsure what XML format is used by a metadata document. The format of the document will be checked and the correct conversion will be performed to transform its content to the ArcGIS metadata XML format. This option is not supported as an export format.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDImportExportOption.esriCurrentMetadataStyle
member.summary: The format of the metadata document that will be imported is assumed to match the XML format of metadata standard associated with the current metadata style. Exported metadata documents will be created in the XML format of the current metadata style.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDImportExportOption.esriEsriIso
member.summary: The metadata document that will be imported has content stored in the ESRI-ISO metadata format. For example, it may have been created using ArcGIS Desktop 8.x or 9.x. This option is not supported as an export format.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDImportExportOption.esriFgdcCsdgm
member.summary: The metadata document that will be imported has content stored in the FGDC CSDGM XML format. Or, the metadata document that will be exported will have content stored in the FGDC CSDGM XML format.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDImportExportOption.esriIso19139Gml32
member.summary: The metadata document that will be imported has content stored in the ISO 19139 XML format. Or, the metadata document that will be exported will have content stored in the ISO 19139 XML format. The GML namespace used in the ISO 19139 XML document is appropriate for the 2012 version of the ISO 19139 XML Schemas, which corresponds to the ISO 19136 version of the GML standard: http://www.opengis.net/gml/3.2.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDImportExportOption.esriIso19139
member.summary: The metadata document that will be imported has content stored in the ISO 19139 XML format. Or, the metadata document that will be exported will have content stored in the ISO 19139 XML format. The GML namespace used in ISO 19139 XML document is appropriate for the 2007 version of the ISO 19139 XML Schemas: http://www.opengis.net/gml.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDImportExportOption.esriIso19139Unknown
member.summary: The metadata document that will be imported has content stored in the ISO 19139 XML format. Use this option if you are unsure which GML namespace the document is associated with. The namespace in the document will be checked and the correct conversion will be performed to transform its content to the ArcGIS metadata XML format. This option is not supported as an export format.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDImportExportOption.esriCustomizedStyleSheet
member.summary: A custom XSLT will be used to convert between ArcGIS metadata and another XML format, either during the import process or the export process.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDImportExportOption.esriIso19115_3
member.summary: The metadata document that will be exported has content stored in the ISO 19115-3 metadata format. This option is not supported as an import format.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDUpgradeOption
member.summary: Enumeration of options for upgrading an item’s metadata to the ArcGIS metadata format. This option is provided to update metadata that was created with ArcGIS Desktop 8.x or 9.x..

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDUpgradeOption.esriUpgradeEsriIso
member.summary: Upgrade ESRI-ISO format metadata content included in the item’s metadata to the ArcGIS metadata format. For example, this content may have been created with ArcGIS Desktop ISO metadata wizard.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDUpgradeOption.esriUpgradeFgdcCsdgm
member.summary: Upgrade FGDC CSDGM-format metadata content included in the item’s metadata to the ArcGIS metadata format. For example, this content may have been created with ArcGIS Desktop FGDC CSDGM metadata editor.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.MDDeleteContentOption

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.BaseDynamicMenu.GetCurrentRootProjectDockPaneVM
member.summary: The calls to CoreModule.Current.GetSelectemItem(true, true) return the CurrentRoot if the active catalog window is the catalog view (ProjectPaneVM), but return null if the active catalog window is a catalog dock pane (ProjectDockPaneVM). This method allows us to get the ProjectVM from catalog dock pane if the current root is a ProjectVM without changing the logic in CoreModule.GetSelectedItem(). That way, derived menus can be shown as a context menu in the ProjectDockPane (Ex. New, Add, etc).

member.summary: Retrieves the raw path name. A raw path is something that might not exist and may include environment variables that need to be expanded.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ShortcutResolver.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NO_UI
member.summary: Do not display a dialog box if the link cannot be resolved. When SLR_NO_UI is set, the high-order word of fFlags can be set to a time-out value that specifies the maximum amount of time to be spent resolving the link. The function returns if the link cannot be resolved within the time-out duration. If the high-order word is set to zero, the time-out duration will be set to the default value of 3,000 milliseconds (3 seconds). To specify a value, set the high word of fFlags to the desired time-out duration, in milliseconds.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ShortcutResolver.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_ANY_MATCH
member.summary: Obsolete and no longer used.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ShortcutResolver.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_UPDATE
member.summary: If the link object has changed, update its path and list of identifiers. If SLR_UPDATE is set, you do not need to call IPersistFile::IsDirty to determine whether or not the link object has changed.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ShortcutResolver.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOUPDATE
member.summary: Do not update the link information.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ShortcutResolver.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOSEARCH
member.summary: Do not execute the search heuristics.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ShortcutResolver.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOTRACK
member.summary: Do not use distributed link tracking.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ShortcutResolver.SLR_FLAGS.SLR_NOLINKINFO
member.summary: Disable distributed link tracking. By default, distributed link tracking tracks removable media across multiple devices based on the volume name. It also uses the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path to track remote file systems whose drive letter has changed. Setting SLR_NOLINKINFO disables both types of tracking.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ItemFactory
member.summary: Creates items that can be added or imported to the project

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ItemFactory.Instance
member.summary: Gets the IItemFactory instance

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ItemFactory.ItemType
member.summary: Specifies the type of item that will be created using , then added or imported to the project

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ItemFactory.ItemType.PathItem
member.summary: A project item will be created and added to the current project in a manner that is appropriate for the identified resource. For example, a map file identified by a file path will be imported and a new MapProjectItem will be added to the project. If the path identifies a locator, a new locator connection will be added to the project.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ItemFactory.ItemType.PortalItem
member.summary: A portal item will be created to reference an item available from the active portal. For example, when the provided URL identifies a feature layer or scene layer, you can add that portal item to a map or scene in your project. If the URL identifies a map package, it can be downloaded and added to the project.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ItemFactory.ItemType.PortalFolderItem
member.summary: An item will be created to reference a folder of resources that is available from the active portal. For example, when the provided URL identifies a folder in My Content, you can use browse the returned item's content and identify the web map you want to add to your project.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ItemFactory.ItemType.CloudItem
member.summary: An item will be created to reference an item available on a cloud hosted service. For example, when the provided URL identifies a BIM or CAD file on Autodesk BIM 360 Docs, it can be downloaded and added to a map or scene in your project.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ItemFactory.Create(System.String,ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ItemFactory.ItemType)
member.summary: Creates a representing the resource identified by the Uri
member.param: The full path to the item on disk or portal item identifier for a resource that will be created
(optional) The type of item that is expected to be created, as specified by . (default value = PathItem)
member.remarks:
Items stored on a local or network computer are identified as "PathItem". The path can point to a mapx, mxd, sxd, tbx, and so forth. The item factory creates a for all of these file types.
Items available from the active portal are identified as either "PortalItem" or "PortalFolderItem". The Uri must be the item id and can point to portal or online content. The item's portal or online is assumed to be the active portal. If there is no active portal or the item's portal (or online if it is in online) is not the active portal then the Create will fail and null will be returned. Portal items can be cast to
Note: To access a folder of items available from the active portal, the folder's portal identifier must be provided as the Uri. The folder's portal is assumed to be the active portal same as for creating portal items. Portal folders can be cast to
Items stored on an external cloud platform besides Portal are identified as "CloudItem". The path can point to a dwg, dgn, dxf, rvt, and so on. The item factory creates a for all of these file types.
Items, once created by the factory, can be added to the project using . Adding a file item or portal item to the project creates a project item that lives in the current project (eg a map, a scene, a layout, a style, a database connection, etc.). When you share that project you likewise share its project items. Project item derived types all contain "ProjectItem" in their name (MapProjectItem, StyleProjectItem, FolderConnectionProjectItem, etc.). All project items implement .
Some items, can be imported to a project. In certain cases, importing items into a project can (but not always) result in more than one project item being added. The canonical example being an mxd which can result in a map and a layout being added. Therefore, items that support being imported, implement and can be passed to the method (in addition to - which all items support). This is useful if you want a reference to the imported project item(s) directly (rather than going to Project "Getitems" to retrieve it after it has been added). Test the returned Item from ItemFactory Create for the presence of IProjectMultiItem to see if the given item can use the ImportItem method.
Note: When enumerating folder content (i.e. a FolderConnectionProjectItem) in the API (via a "GetItems" call), the Items returned will be file item or "PathItem" "Item" types (whether mapx, mdxs, sxds, etc.). They are the same "Item" as would be created via a call to ItemFactory Create using their path as the uri. They are not treated differently.
Note: Items should be created on a QueuedTask.
member.returns: or null if an item cannot be created or found

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CreateProjectSettings
member.summary: Provides the settings used to create a new project

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CreateProjectSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an empty instance of the class.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CreateProjectSettings.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the name of the project that will be created

remarks.para: The default project name is "MyProject". If not set, a name is generated appropriately for the LocationPath. For example, if the LocationPath already contains projects named MyProject, MyProject1 and MyProject2, the name MyProject3 will be used for the new project.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CreateProjectSettings.LocationPath
member.summary: Gets and sets the location where the project will be stored

remarks.para: If not set, projects are saved in the user's My Documents\ArcGIS\Projects folder; this folder is created if it doesn't already exist.
If the LocationPath property is set, the new project will be created in the provided location; the specified folder must already exist on disk.
LocationPath is ignored if the TemplateType is set to Untitled.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CreateProjectSettings.TemplatePath
member.summary: Gets and sets the path to the project template that will be used to create the new project

remarks.para: When a new project is created using a project template, the set of maps, layouts, tasks, styles, database connections, and so on, defined in the template are transferred to the new project.
Providing a URL to use a project template available from a portal or ArcGIS Online will throw a FileNotFound exception in the call to Project.CreateAsync().
TemplateType is ignored if the TemplatePath is set.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CreateProjectSettings.TemplateType
member.summary: Gets and sets the project template type that will be used to create the new project
member.remarks:
The default is TemplateType.Catalog.
Setting the TemplatePath overrides the TemplateType.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CreateProjectSettings.CreateNewProjectFolder
member.summary: Gets and sets a value indicating if a new folder will be created for this project

remarks.para: By default, a new folder is created for all new projects. The ArcGIS Pro application settings may specify that a folder should never be created for new projects. If the CreateProjectFolder property is not set, and the application settings specify not to create a folder, a folder will not be created for the new project.

If the CreateProjectFolder property is set, the provided value overrides the application settings. For example, if true and the specified project name is TestProject, a new folder TestProject will be created in the LocationPath folder, and the TestProject.aprx project will be stored in the new folder.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.TemplateType
member.summary: Gets and sets the project system template type that will be used to create the new project

remarks.para: Gets and sets the project system template type that will be used to create the new project Remarks: The selected template type will be applied when creating a new project.Supplying a full path to a template overrides this setting.The supplied template will be used instead of the supplied system template setting.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.TemplateType.Catalog
member.summary: Create a new project with an open catalog view. For example, create a project like this to manage your data.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.TemplateType.Map
member.summary: Create a new project with an open 2D map.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.TemplateType.LocalScene
member.summary: Create a new project with an open 3D local scene.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.TemplateType.GlobalScene
member.summary: Create a new project with an open 3D global scene.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.TemplateType.Untitled
member.summary: Start working in ArcGIS Pro without creating a project first. You can save a project later if you want to keep your work.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project
member.summary: Represents an ArcGIS Pro project

remarks.para: An ArcGIS Pro project must be created or opened before you can start to use the application

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.Current
member.summary: Gets the project that is currently open in the ArcGIS Pro application

remarks.para: Only one project can be opened at a time in ArcGIS Pro. When another project is opened or a new project is created, this property is updated to reflect the newly opened project.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.GetDefaultProjectSettings
member.summary: Get the default project settings

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.CreateAsync(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CreateProjectSettings)
member.summary: Creates a new project with properties determined by CreateProjectSettings

remarks.para:
To create a project with system defaults, please use the CreateProjectSettings.TemplateType property. Use of the system templates via the template path is deprecated as of 2.3.
The default TemplateType is TemplateType.Catalog. Either set a different TemplateType (as needed) or provide a full path to a Pro project template in TemplatePath, in which case the TemplateType is ignored.
If CreateProjectSettings is null, a new untitled project is created (TemplateType.Untitled).

An invalid CreateProjectSettings.TemplatePath will throw a "Path { path here } not found" FileNotFoundException. This includes use of a portal or online Pro project template item URI. The template should be downloaded first.

member.exception: Path { path here } not found.
member.param: (optional) The settings that will be use to create a new project. (default value = null)
member.returns: A Task returning the new project that was created

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.OpenAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Opens an existing project or project package

remarks.para: ArcGIS Pro can open projects or project packages stored on a local or network computer. ArcGIS Pro can also open project packages available from a portal or ArcGIS Online, if an appropriate URL is provided. You must sign in to the organization that hosts the project package if it is not public.
If appropriate, a project package is first downloaded from a portal to the user profile directory. Project packages are unpacked, then the project file (*.aprx) it contains is opened by ArcGIS Pro.
If a project is currently open in ArcGIS Pro, it will be closed before the specified project is opened.

member.param: The full path or URL to the project or project package that will be opened
member.returns: A Task returning the project that was opened

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.CanOpen(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Checks if the specified project or project package can be opened
member.param: The full path or URL to the project or project package that will be opened
The version of ArcGIS Pro that was used to create the project or project package, for example, "1.0.2" or "1.1.0". A value will not be provided if the specified item is not recognized as a project.
member.returns: A boolean indicating if the project or project package can be opened

member.summary: Gets if the project is opened in a read-only state

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.UntitledMode
member.summary: Gets if the project is opened in a read-only state

remarks.para: When you open a project, if it is already in use, it will open in read-only mode even if the project is otherwise writable. Only one writable instance of a project can be opened at a time.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.URI
member.summary: Gets the location of the current project; that is, the path to the current project file (*.aprx)

remarks.para: When you open a project package, either from a local drive or the active portal, the package is unpacked and the project file (*.aprx) it contains is opened by ArcGIS Pro. This property gets the location of the currently open project file, not the URI of the original project package.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.HomeFolderPath
member.summary: Gets the current project's home folder

member.summary: Gets the current project's default toolbox

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.Items
member.summary: Gets the current project's collection of project items

remarks.para: Returns the current collection of project items: the maps, layouts, toolboxes, databases, folder connections, locators, and so on that have been added to the project.

A folder connection is a project item. Subfolders and files accessed using a folder connection are items, but are not project items; they have not been added to a project. Similarly, databases that have been added to a project are project items, but databases accessed from a folder connection are items. The items within a database are always items, not project items.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.GetItems``1
member.summary: Gets a collection of a specific type of items within the project
member.typeparam: The ProjectItem type that is used to filter the complete list of project items

remarks.para: To return all the databases in the project, for example, provide the appropriate project item type. For example, see the GDBProjectItem class in the ArcGIS.Desktop.Catalog namespace.

If a type is not provided, all items that have been added to the current project will be returned, including the maps, layouts, toolboxes, default geodatabase, the home folder connection, and so on. A folder connection is a project item; subfolders and files accessed using a folder connection are items but are not project items because they have not been added to a project.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.ProjectItemContainers
member.summary: Gets the list of project item containers
member.remarks:
The project item containers correspond to the catalog pane nodes on the "Project Tab" and their counterparts on catalog views. A container is needed only in those situations where you want to select a specific item that occurs in more than one container.
The list of containers can vary depending on the content within a given project. Some containers that are instantiated in one project can be null in others
Containers also include non-visible internal containers. These can be ignored.
Public containers (not including any 3rd party custom containers):
Display Name(English)Path or "Key" (Non-localizable)Item content
DatabasesGDBDatabase content
FoldersFolderConnectionFiles and Folders
LayoutsLayoutLayouts
LocatorsLocatorsConnectionLocators
MapsMapMaps
Raster Function TemplatesRasterFunctionTemplatesRaster function templates
Reviewer Batch JobsDataReviewerBatchJobsReviewer batch jobs
Reviewer ResultsDataReviewerResourcesReviewer results
ServersServerConnectionServer connections
StylesStyleStyles
TasksTaskTasks
ToolboxesGPToolboxes
WorkflowsWorkflowConnectionWorkflows
member.returns: The list of containers as

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.GetProjectItemContainer(System.String)
member.summary: Get the container with the given key. Container keys are not localized. A container is needed only in those situations where you want to select a specific item that occurs in more than one container.
member.param: The key for the given container
member.remarks:
Containers can vary from project to project depending on the content. Some containers, therefore, can be null. You can use the following keys to retrieve a container. Check for null.
Public containers (not including any 3rd party custom containers):

member.returns: The container or null

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.IsDirty
member.summary: Gets the dirty state of the project

remarks.para: The project's dirty state indicates changes made to the project have not yet been saved. For example, after adding a map to the project, IsDirty will return True and the Save button is enabled.

member.returns: True if the project is dirty

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.SetDirty(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the dirty state of the project
member.param: (optional) The project's new dirty state. true indicates changes have not been saved; false indicates no changes have been made. (default value = true)

remarks.para: If the project's dirty state is set to true, you will be prompted to save changes when another project is opened or when you exit the ArcGIS Pro application.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.SaveAsync
member.summary: Saves the project

remarks.para: The project file (*.aprx) stored on disk is replaced by a new version of the file representing the current state of the project. For example, this ensures the maps and layouts you created will be available the next time you open this project. Data displayed in a map is not saved in the project; the connections used to access the data are saved.
Saving the project requires write access to the location where the project is stored. If another person is using the same project file at the same time, saving your changes will not succeed.

member.returns: A Task returning an indication if the operation was successful or not; true if the save operation succeeds
member.exception: The save location can not be found or accessed
The save location may be on a full disk
There was an unspecified write error while saving
There was an unspecified error while saving

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.SaveAsAsync(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves a copy of the current project file (*.aprx) to the specified location with the specified file name, then opens the new project file
member.param: The full path to the location where the new project file will be stored, including the file name for the new project file
(optional) A boolean indicating if an existing project file in the specified location with the same name should be overwritten or not. (default value = false)

remarks.para: Save As provides a way to save a copy of the current project file (*.aprx) in a new location with a new name. If you save the project to another location, folders will be created accordingly to satisfy the provided folder path if they don't already exist. You must have write access to the location where the new project file is stored.

SaveAsAsync copies the project file only. The new project file continues to reference the same home folder, default geodatabase, and default toolbox as the current project. Paths to these items will be updated appropriately based on the new project file's location. For example, if the current project's default geodatabase is accessed by relative path because the default geodatabase and the project file are stored on the same local disk, such as C:, and you save the new project file to a different local disk drive, such as D:, the new project file will access the same default geodatabase using a fully-qualified path instead of a relative path.

If you use SaveAsAsync to save the new project file in the same location as the current project with a new name, you have effectively renamed the current project. Afterwards, you can delete the copy of the project file with the old name.
After successfully creating the new file, the current project is closed and the new project file is opened. See also

member.returns: A Task returning a success result
member.exception: The save location can not be found or accessed
The save location may be on a full disk
There was an unspecified write error while saving
There was an unspecified error while saving

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.SearchAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Searches the project for items that match the provided criteria
member.param: Search criteria specifying the items you want to find

remarks.para: When items are added to the project, they are indexed immediately by default. If you open a project created by someone else, indexing starts when a new item is added to the project or the first time you try to search for items in the project. Items can be searched as soon as indexing is complete. When you search the current project, only items associated with the current project are searched.

When items are indexed, their type, file name, title, tags, summary, description, credits, use limitations, and a few properties are recorded in a Lucene index that is stored on the local machine. These may be derived from the item's metadata, if it exists.

The search criteria may be a general set of keywords specifying what you are looking for, like when you search for information on the internet. These keywords can reflect the properties of the item or information provided in its metadata, such as "excel table" or "national park". You can refine the search by specifying only the fields in which to look for the specified word or phrase. For example, to search for a word only in the item's set of tags, specify the criteria "tags:park", or in the summary "summary:aristida purpurea species"

member.returns: A Task returning a collection of

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.SetDefaultGeoDatabasePath(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the current project's default geodatabase. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.

remarks.para: By default, a new file geodatabase is created in the project's home folder and used as its default geodatabase. However, the default geodatabase can be set to another existing geodatabase. For example, if you add a schema-only layer package to a map, the schema required by the layer is generated in the project's default geodatabase. A project is required to have a default geodatabase.

The ArcGIS Pro application settings may specify a geodatabase that should always be used as the default geodatabase. Anyone using the project is expected to have write access to and appropriate permissions in that geodatabase. If a project uses a file geodatabase as the default geodatabase and the file geodatabase is not available in the specified location, a file geodatabase will be created accordingly to satisfy the default geodatabase path.
At this time, only file geodatabases can be used as a project's default geodatabase.

member.param: The full path to the geodatabase that will be used
member.exception: This method or property must be called within the lambda passed to QueuedTask.Run.
input path cannot be resolved as default geodatabase.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.SetDefaultToolboxPath(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the current project's default toolbox. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.

remarks.para: By default, a new toolbox is created in the project's home folder and used as its default toolbox. However, the default toolbox can be set to another existing toolbox. For example, if you create a new model from the Analysis tab on the ribbon in ArcGIS Pro, a new model is created in the default toolbox. A project is required to have a default toolbox.

The ArcGIS Pro application settings may specify a toolbox that should always be used as the default toolbox. Anyone using the project is expected to have write access to that toolbox. If a project's default toolbox is not available in the specified location, a toolbox will be created accordingly to satisfy the default toolbox path.

At this time, only standard toolboxes (*.tbx) in the file system should be used as a project's default toolbox. If the project's default toolbox is set to use a Python toolbox (*.pyt), creating a new model from the Analysis tab on the ribbon will fail; models can't be created in Python toolboxes.

member.param: The full path to the toolbox that will be used
member.exception: This method or property must be called within the lambda passed to QueuedTask.Run.
input path cannot be resolved as default toolbox.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.SetHomeFolderPath(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the current project's home folder. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.

remarks.para: By default, a project's location is also its home folder. However, the home folder can be set to another location on a local or network disk. For example, new database or server connection files created in ArcGIS Pro are stored in the project's home folder. A project is required to have a home folder.

If a project is stored on a network computer, you might want to change its home folder to reference a folder on the local computer instead. Anyone who uses the project will be expected to have write access to that folder location. If a project's home folder is not available in the specified location, folders will be created accordingly to satisfy the home folder path. If a project is placed on a network computer that references a home folder in a user's profile directory on their local machine, when another person uses the same project on a different computer folders will be created to generate the original user's profile directory if the user has permission to do so.
Note that only one person can work with an ArcGIS Pro project at a time. If a project is placed on a network computer, many people can't use it at once.

member.param: The full path to the location that will be used as the project's home folder
member.exception: This method or property must be called within the lambda passed to QueuedTask.Run.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.IsEditingEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if editing is enabled.
member.returns: True if editing is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: While this value is true, all editing tools and feature templates are enabled; otherwise, they are disabled. While this value is false, EditOperations will fail. Use the ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.SetIsEditingEnabledAsync method to enable or disable editing within the application.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.SetIsEditingEnabledAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a value that indicates if editing is to be enabled or disabled within the application.
member.returns: A task representing a value indicating if the method was successful.
member.remarks: Use this method to enable or disable editing within the application. Setting this value is independent of the visibility of the Enable/Disable editing control on the Edit Tab. If the project has unsaved edits, setting this value to false will not succeed, those edits must be saved or discarded first. Use the ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.IsEditingEnabled property to determine if editing is enabled or disabled within the application.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Project.RemoveItem(ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.IProjectItem)
member.summary: Removes the project item from the current project. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: The to be removed
member.remarks: For items that are referenced by the project such as a folder, the folder connection is removed from the project but the folder continues to exist on the local disk or network. However, for items stored in the project such as maps and layouts, the map or layout definition is deleted when the project item is removed.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.Item.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the collection of children. Use to determine the correct thread for performing a refresh.
member.remarks:
Certain Items must be refreshed on the MCT. Use to check. A true return value means the item must be refreshed on the MCT using QueuedTask.Run. SDE Items, for example, must be refreshed on the MCT. A false return value means the Item can be refreshed on any thread, including the UI, although using is preferred.
Calling Refresh on the wrong thread for items where IsMainThreadRequired returns true will throw a .
member.exception: This method or property must be called within the lambda passed to QueuedTask.Run.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.ItemCategory
member.summary: Provides a base class for ItemCategory classes defined in DAML

remarks.para: An item category defines a collection of item types, and facilitates filtering a collection of items. An item category consists of a DAML declaration and a class derived from the ItemCategory class. For example, a category could define a relationship between the feature classes, relationship classes and tables in a geodatabase. The item category allows you retrieve an enumerable collection of items associated with the category at once from a given item. Use of the ItemCategory is not recursive. That is, when you retrieve items from a folder, the result will not include items stored within subfolders.

member.returns: A Task returning an enumerable collection of

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CustomItemBase
member.summary: Base class for deriving custom items. Custom items are shown in the Catalog View and Pane
member.remarks:
Custom items that have a physical file representation on disk should registered their file extension within the Config.daml so that they can be browsed within Folder collection in Catalog. Registration is within the esri_customItems category and should include the fileExtension of your custom item and keywords that can be used in the Catalog search. Note: The Pro SDK template for custom items will automatically generate a set of Config.daml entries for you.
Custom items that can contain child items should set IsContainer=true. The custom item method is called when the item is first expanded in the Catalog to allow custom items to retrieve their child items

member.summary: Called when your custom project item is being added to the project.

The content of the ProjectItemInfo is what is added to the project for your given item. In your custom project item implementation it must be populated as follows:
o ProjectItemInfo Name: your Item.Name
o ProjectItemInfo Type: Your Container Type
o ProjectItemInfo Path: Your physical path to the item
o ProjectItemInfo Data: Empty string. For internal use only

member.summary: Use to include the custom item within packages and project templates

This method should be called by the item container's
method when the item is being created. By default items are not included (in packages, etc) so calling this method on a newly created item with "false" is redundant.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CustomProjectItemContainer`1
member.summary: A custom project item container contains custom project items of a specific type that have been added to a project.
member.remarks:
By default, empty project item containers are not visible in the Catalog pane or view. They only become visible once they contain at least one (custom) project item. Custom project item containers are registered in the Config.daml within the esri_core_projectContainers category. Custom project item containers have an associated "container type" which is an arbitrary unique string used to identify your container within the project container collection.
Custom project items must know their corresponding custom project item container container type.
member.typeparam: The type of custom project item the container will contain

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.CustomProjectItemContainer`1.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: A string identifier for your container
member.remarks: The containerType can be used to retrieve your container from the collection of project containers. It should be known to the custom project item implementation.

The physical path of the item
The container type.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.PortalProjectConfigViewModel.AllConfigPathSettingsAreEmpty
member.summary: If true, then the home folder, default Geodatabase, and default toolbox settings values for portal projects are all empty at the time an instance of this class is constructed. That value can then be used by the new portal project dialog to determine if the user should be asked if they want to save any changes to the user.settings.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.PortalProjectInfoViewModel.#ctor(System.String)
member.remarks: The associated PortalProjectInfoView needed to support functionality very similar to that found in the sharing pane. However, those controls and supporting classes are in the ArcGIS.Desktop.Sharing project. Controls like the TaggingControl and AutoCompleteCombobox that are used in the sharing pane are used here, but this view model has had many properties copied from sharing view model classes in order to provide the needed properties in the DataContext. (PackageViewModelBase, WebLayerViewModel, SharingPaneViewModel). Additionally, functionality in SharingModule, SharingPaneViewModel, and SharingUtilities were exposed via new interfaces located here in ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.PKIAuthenticationDlgViewModel.IsClientAuthenticationCertificate(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.summary: https://security.stackexchange.com/questions/68491/recommended-key-usage-for-a-client-certificate So in practice for libNSS ( as got from mercurial reposoritory https://hg.mozilla.org/projects/nss on 25th October 2015 ) to be valid client certificate, it should match one of those assertions : 1. EKU AND KU are NOT set. 2. KU is not set AND EKU is set to clientAuth AND cert is NOT a CA. 3. KU contains digitalSignature AND EKU is NOT set 4. KU contains digitalSignature AND EKU is set to clientAuth AND cert is NOT a CA.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Core.PortalItemViewModel.CalculateHue(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: The hue, in degrees, of this System.Drawing.Color, ranging from 0.0 through 360.0, in HSL color space We have static set of hues in 'hues' array Scale the 0-360 hue range to 0-hueCount, and return one of our static hues Example : fHue = 188.3, hueCount = 10 hueIndex = (int)(188.3 * 9)/360 = 4.7 = 5

The y coordinate
The spatial reference. WGS84 is assumed if sr is null

If the spatial reference is null then WGS84 is assumed.
